Sentencas: In situ nanoparticle exsolution is an excellent strategy to enhance the electrocatalytic activity of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrodes.
Titulo: Enhancing Ni Exsolution by Nonmetal B-Site Substituents (Si and P) in SrTiO3-Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Herein, we report that Si and P can be used as B-site nonmetal substituents to improve the electrochemical performance of the model SOFC anode SrTiO3-delta after testing different Si- and P-substitution levels.
Titulo: Enhancing Ni Exsolution by Nonmetal B-Site Substituents (Si and P) in SrTiO3-Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: First-principles calculations show that Si- or P-substitution promotes the Ni diffusion as well as its segregation toward the surface.
Titulo: Enhancing Ni Exsolution by Nonmetal B-Site Substituents (Si and P) in SrTiO3-Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Related experiments show that the area-specific resistance (ASR) measured at 800 degrees C in 3% humidified H-2 improves upon Si- and P-substitution from 0.600 Omega cm(2) for Sr0.8Ti0.9Ni0.1O3-delta (STN) to 0.061
Titulo: Enhancing Ni Exsolution by Nonmetal B-Site Substituents (Si and P) in SrTiO3-Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Omega cm(2) for Sr0.8Ti0.85Ni0.1Si0.005O3-delta and 0.056 Omega cm(2) for Sr0.8Ti0.85Ni0.1Si0.005O3-delta.
Titulo: Enhancing Ni Exsolution by Nonmetal B-Site Substituents (Si and P) in SrTiO3-Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Moreover, the P-substituted material shows excellent stability with a symmetric cell, retaining its ASR for 70 h in 3% humidified H-2.
Titulo: Enhancing Ni Exsolution by Nonmetal B-Site Substituents (Si and P) in SrTiO3-Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy measurements reveal that even a slight nonmetal substitution can reduce Ni to a lower oxidation state than STN before exsolution.
Titulo: Enhancing Ni Exsolution by Nonmetal B-Site Substituents (Si and P) in SrTiO3-Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: In turn, this promotes the reduction of Ni during exsolution, which improves the ASR.
Titulo: Enhancing Ni Exsolution by Nonmetal B-Site Substituents (Si and P) in SrTiO3-Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: For the first time, nonmetal substituents in perovskite oxides are utilized to aid Ni exsolution from the host lattice, opening new avenues to improve the electrochemical activity.
Titulo: Enhancing Ni Exsolution by Nonmetal B-Site Substituents (Si and P) in SrTiO3-Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes
